cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 195 mi ESE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking west-northwest, then turning northwest and slowing as it approaches the south-east Louisiana / Mississippi Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana or Mississippi coast (near the Mouth of the Mississippi River–Ocean Springs MS)

weather_observation.watch_coast: East of Ocean Springs MS to the AL/FL border (Hurricane Watch and Storm-Surge Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Morgan City LA to Ocean Springs MS including Lake Pontchartrain & Lake Maurepas;  Storm-Surge Warning: Port Fourchon LA to the MS/AL border and Lakes Borgne, Pontchartrain & Maurepas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through the Mississippi and Alabama coasts and western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40-60 mph) are likely by Monday afternoon with a 44 % chance of sustained 50-kt (58 mph) winds; hurricane-force gusts possible Monday night into Tuesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 4–6 ft is forecast inside Lake Pontchartrain and adjacent coastal areas near New Orleans; locally higher where onshore flow persists.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches with isolated totals up to 24 inches Monday–Wednesday; significant flash-flood threat and river rises around the port complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes beginning Monday afternoon; dangerous surf and rip-current conditions along exposed channels and jetties.
